headline: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
description: Aglio e olio is a deliciously simple Italian dish of fresh garlic, olive oil, and Parmesan cheese tossed with freshly cooked spaghetti pasta.

video.description: See how to make a super-popular, incredibly easy Italian pasta.
video.name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio

name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
recipeIngredient: 0.25 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and transfer to a pasta bowl.

While the pasta is cooking, combine olive oil and garlic in a cold skillet. Cook over medium heat to slowly toast garlic, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low when olive oil begins to bubble. Cook and stir until garlic is golden brown, about another 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper into pasta. Pour in hot olive oil and garlic, and sprinkle on Italian parsley and half of the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese; toss until combined.
Serve pasta topped with the remaining Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

review.reviewBody: Not as good as a lot of his recipes are, however, it was tasty. But I did use more garlic. I think I am part vampire.
It needs toasted bread crumbs in the end... like my nonna made it!
So Good and takes so little time and effort to make!
I loved it! I didn't have any red pepper flakes, and I adjusted the recipe for serving one person. It is now one of my favourite pasta dishes.
Finally a spaghetti dish my husband loves! I could live on pasta, but not him until this dish. Yay!!!

OMG!! Absolutely tasty and quick. Not pop in the microwave quick; it took me about half an hour. The longest step was slicing the garlic while the pasta cooked. I used a combo of grated romano and shaved parmesan. Perfect comfort food for a rainy day!
Definitely needed more red pepper. And tons of cheese to top it.

It is FARRR from my Italian mothers Aglio Olio. Not enough oil and water in the " scorching hot " oil with the paprika. the garlic and paprika is added 1st to the hot oil, allowed to semi-scorch for 5-10 seconds, the add the "cold" water turning the pot into a volcano of steam for a few seconds! This recipe is good, but not Momma's !!
Add in basil, cherry tomatoes, a bit of the water from the cooked pasta, chorizo sausage and if I am lucky scallops.

I made for visiting friends and they loved it. I followed the instructions exactly. Super easy to prepare and takes as long as it takes to boil water for your pasta. Next time I’m going to double all the ingredients so it’s extra saucy. A definite winner!
Delicious! All family loved it.
a great dish for these pressing times
I liked it, but I would add more garlic the next time as it lacked flavor. I made 1/2 of the recipe for the 2 of us and had a large serving left over for lunch the next day.
A very good recipe. I didn't use quite as much oil as the recipe called for and added kalamata olives and capers. This would have been delicious even without thise additions.
I make Chef's recipes as written... I've made this many times and it's the ultimate deliciousness. Thank you, Chef!
So simple & easy to make. Tasty for me
Fast, easy and Delicious!
Love it and make regularly
It's a favorite.
I've made this dish countless times. It's easy and delicious! Thanks Chef John!
This recipe is awesome! Will definitely make again.
Recipe forgetting to add spaghettie water
Used quinoa noodles as a healthier option and it still turned out amazing.
Very good and easy to make. I tripled the red pepper amount, buy then I like food a little spicier than most folks.

Excellent! Our favorite Italian restaurant owner retired and we really missed this dish. I found this by Chef John and it’s every bit as good (except for the work LOL). Will definitely be a quick and easy to prepare go to meal so satisfying!
added shrimp

Great recipe .. very enjoyable easy to follow and the tip regarding over cooking the garlic was very helpful
Think that's where I was going wrong x

As written this recipe is spot on - large servings for 4, side dish for 6. The beauty of it is the versatility - I add cooked veggies I have leftover or fresh spinach or shrimp or chicken - add ins go on forever - tomatoes and burratta with some fresh basil are amazing here. You can make it as simple or complex as you like.

I’ve made this dish a few times and with the last couple of times it’s been phenomenal. I made it yesterday with a new twist to it. I let the linguine simmer with the garlic oil for about 10 to 15 minutes on a very low heat with some basil. Turned out very flavorful.
I have made this so many times. its one of my favourite pasta recipes!

I made this with normal spaghetti for “the others” but made myself a serving of gluten free pasta. I gotta say it even made gluten free pasta delish! Very happy! I know it isn’t traditional, but the next time I plan on adding mushrooms and whatever other veggies I happen to have!
I just tried this recipe out for dinner. It's friggin' great. Simple and relatively quick. Delicious.
So simple. So delicious!
Delicious!
Great Recipe, we LOVED it!!!
We loved it!!
Easy and made the perfect side to Marsala Chicken.
Follow recipe as is! Delicious!
AMAZING RECIPIE! For me it took a little longer than 5 minutes for the garlic to brown but there was nothing wrong with the actual recipie! ?
adding the pasta water was a disaster cause the oil was too hot
It was awesome very easy and flavorful. Loved it.
Loved it! Served with crab legs. Very yummy.

I was looking for a simple recipe that will make me use a small bottle of truffle oil that came with a birthday gift package and this was it! I didn't change anything, just drizzled the truffle oil after, mixed, and transfered the linguini to the serving plate. I sprinkled it with shaved parmegiano-reggiano. and chopped parsley and it was ready to serve. I also made the Baked Chicken Breasts that I seasoned then dipped in mayonnaise and cheese then bread crumbs before outting in the oven. So moist and tender.
So easy, so good!
Loved it! Might cut back the oil slightly in the future but the garlic roasted beautifully and the hint of red pepper (which I actully used my own home grown cayenne pepper flakes) made it amazing.
Excellent..doesn't overpower the pasta

The first time I made it, I used dried parsley and diced garlic that you but in a jar. It was ok. I didn’t want it again but my daughter loved it. So... I made it again tonight but used fresh ingredients and added slightly more oil and red pepper flakes. It was delicious and everyone loved it this time!
Simple - and delicious
Garlic Oil - don't over toast, lightly brown. Add pasta water to the oil and garlic once you remove from the stove.
paired this recipe with the seafood bake for two...so good!

this recipe is so newbie friendly and I am amazed at the ease with which I prepared the dish using the recipe. and since I didn't have parsley, I used basil which definitely enhanced the flavor and aroma of the dish. and I also used Manchego, but just a tad because its flavor overpowers.
Excellent and easy. If you need something quick, this is it.
I LOVED THIS SPAGWHTI
OMG. How does something so simple taste so good?

interesting dish have eaten something very similar before but real heavy on the crushed red pepper next time I make this I'd like to throw some diced pancetta in with the garlic and olive oil and see what happens
Super easy variation on my own method. I loved it. I served with brocollini and lobster tail. Super quick and easy.
A fast and easy pasta option. Used fettuccine instead of spaghetti. Don't forget the chopped parsley.
I made this Dish and my 11year old daughter loved it! I did cut down a little bit on the olive oil and it came out perfect.. I will difenally make it again.
Cooked as the recipe called for. It was very good.
Easy to make and very flavorful. I let it sit for a few minutes before serving it and toss it several times as well.

This was very good, simple, and easy. I had minced garlic that toasted up nicely, and my red pepper flakes are very mild, so the kids didn't have a problem with any spiciness. I would use about half the olive oil next time though; it was too oily for my taste.

I've been making this for years and I love it! The only difference is I use less oil and instead of parsley I use Oregano. Sometimes I switch it up by adding broccoli and/or cut up chicken or shrimp. Good stuff!
this is my husband's new favorite and he is a very picky eater
Easy and simple recipe spaghetti choice of ingredients are balanced and the recipe is healthy as how it is presented.
How can something so easy be so loaded with flavor?! This is Italian soul food.
First time I made this and it turned out absolutely amazing!!

Questa pasta e stata superba! This pasta was superb! It helps very much if you watch Chef John's video just before preparing the dish. Just as a reminder on how to successfully toast the garlic in the olive oil. Adding the pasta water to the toasted garlic really aids in coating each strand of spaghetti with all that goodness. My husband added sautéed shrimp & mushrooms to his dish. Such an easy and delicious meal with a garden salad and garlic bread. Company worthy! Thanks Chef John!
Added mushrooms, spinach and few pieces of Gouda tomato basil cheese. It was delicious.
Morty and I love this dish!!
Don't change a thing.
I made it but I did not have parsley in it.
This is a staple, easy, pasta dish that I LOVE making. It is delicious but simple. 100% recommend!

Second round with this recipe. As always, Chef Johns recipes are fool-proof versions when you’re trying to choose. Doing it with fresh pasta and hoping my garden oregano makes decent substitute for the parsley I don’t have. So easy and everyone loves it!!
Excellent recipe. The "cold skillet for the garlic" is key.
Good start on this classic.
It was good and the recipe worked out!

This was delicious. I added chicken to the mix for more sustenance and protein. Cooked the chicken is a skillet with its own olive oil and roasted garlic mixture. Seasoned the chicken with salt, pepper, oregano and a little bit of crushed red pepper. Next time may throw some peppers or spinach to the oil. Family loved it, box and a half of pasta and 3 chicken breasts with nothing left to show for it!
it was good. you should try it. end of sentence.

Very Very good. The first time I had this dinner was in London, and an Italian Restaurant. They were not very busy so the chef sat with me and we talked while I lunched. I have tried it a few different ways, but this recipe is the closest that I've had. Wonderful.
I added a little more cheese but it was great!

I love this dish. It's been a staple of mine for years. While I use the same ingredients, I find it much easier to mix all the ingredients, except the cheese, in the pan with the olive oil and garlic. I pour it over the drained pasta and then add half the cheese and mix well.
A few other notes: I don't like to brown the garlic. I find that makes it bitter. Here's what I do: heat the oil over medium heat. When it's hot, turn the heat to low and add the garlic. Saute it slowly until it's soft and translucent, but not brown. It takes about 5 minutes. Then add the pepper flakes, black pepper, and salt. Heat for a few minutes to blend flavors. Add the parsley. Then pour the sauce over the drained pasta and mix well.

I use 3/4 Cup of olive oil for each pound of pasta.

Also I like to add a can of anchovies to the pan along with the red pepper and black pepper. Stir and break up the anchovies with a fork until they're dissolved. Do not add extra salt when using anchovies.

Buon appetito!
Added shrimp. LOVE the garlic.
We also added some cherry tomatoes and it came out great.
This is really good! It's a fast and easy recipe and a nice change from traditional tomato-based sauces. I substitute parmesan for fresh-grated romano.

Delicious! For someone who spends little time in the kitchen, and who does not enjoy cooking, this was the perfect dish for me to prepare.... it was very easy - and ingredients are almost always available in my pantry. Thank you Chef John!
Nice springtime classic for all the garlic lovers out there! I would be certain to commit to an al dente rendering of the pasta.
Delicious and so easy
Easy to make and tasty--be careful not to overcook the garlic. I'll try i again.

This is very good as a basic recipe to be creative and add almost anything. I tasted the recipe as written before I added sautéed asparagus from the garden. I will make this again but will use more garlic next time. Thank you for the recipe.
This was absolutely delicious. I did add more garlic which made it all the better, Thanks Chef John.
It’s really good!
Tasted so good! Easy to make, even if you don't watch the video.
It is far too oily. Would recommend to use a quarter cup of olive oil at most. Nothing special about this dish.
I love this! To add some protein, I added some chopped cooked seasoned chicken breast. Absolutely amazing!!
Very good pasta, add the grated parmesan just before serving. Make certain to toast the garlic cloves, and drain the pasta before adding to the oil/garlic/onion.
I made this! And i made some kimd of a twist of my owm version with some other herbs plus I stir fried small cut boneless chicken in the oil and add some butter, it taste too good to be true
This went perfect with chicken marsala. The flavors together made it pop. Very good recipe.
I made it and will make it again. The only thing I would change is not so much olive oil.
Really delicious! Followed the recipe pretty much exactly except using a different type of Parmesan that we already had. Great dish for a quick dinner and especially good with whole wheat spaghetti.
